abstractContent.text: Menno van Zaanen (Universiteit van Tilburg, Netherlands) iii

introductionContent.text: These are the proceedings of the 14th International Conference on Finite-State Methods and Natural Language Processing, which was held September in Dresden, Germany.
The conference series FSMNLP is the premier forum of the ACL Special Interest Group on Finite-State Methods (SIGFSM).

It serves researchers and practitioners working on natural language processing (NLP) applications or language resources, theoretical and implementational aspects, or their combinations, that make use of finite-state methods.
FSMNLP 2019 received 20 submissions, each of which was carefully reviewed by at least three experts in the field.
On the basis of these reviews the program committee selected 12 papers to be accepted for presentation at the conference.
In addition to the regular papers, one tutorial and two invited talks were presented:
